metadata.title: CVE-2021-20265 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: A flaw was found in the way memory resources were freed in theunix_stream_recvmsg function in the Linux kernel when a signal was pending.This flaw allows an unprivileged local user to crash the system byexhausting available memory. The highest threat from this vulnerability isto system availability.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
